00040 /**
00041  * @file topic.h
00042  * @date 2008/09/01 7:07
00043  * @author Sergio Montenegro
00044  *
00045  * Copyright 2008 DLR
00046  *
00047  * @brief topic for middleware
00048  *
00049  */
00050 
00051 #pragma once
00052 
00053 #include "debug.h"
00054 #include "gateway/networkmessage.h"
00055 
00056 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00057 namespace RODOS {
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 class NetMsgInfo;
00061 
00062 #define RODOS_LOCAL_BROADCAST   0
00063 
00064 /**
00065  *  @class TopicInterface
00066  *  @brief TopicInterface only for internal use
00067  *
00068  *  The middleware communication is based on the publisher/subscriber protocol.
00069  *  Publishers make messages public under a given topic.
00070  *  Subscriber to a given topic get all messages which are published
00071  *  under the given topic.
00072  * To establish a transfer path, both,
00073  * publisher and subscriber have to share the same topic.
00074  *
00075  * A Topic is a pair: data-type and an integer representing
00076  * a topic identifier.
00077  *
00078  * To access topics in an generic way which is independent of
00079  * data type and topicId, a TopicInterface is created.
00080  *
00081  */
00082 
00083 class TopicInterface : public ListElement {
00084 
00085         friend void initSystem();
00086         friend class Gateway;
00087         friend class Subscriber;
00088         // friend class NetworkPoller; // TODO remove this
00089         friend class TopicReporter;
00090 
00091 public:
00092 
00093 
00094 //protected:
00095         /// List of all topics present in the system
00096         static List topicList;
00097         /// List of pointers to subscribers associated to one topic instance
00098         List mySubscribers;
00099         /// Topic ID used for identification of the correct subscriber 
00100         long topicId;
00101     /// Size of message transfered via this topic
00102         long msgLen;
00103 
00104 
00105 
00106 public:
00107 
00108     TopicInterface(long id, long len, const char* name);
00109 
00110     virtual ~TopicInterface() { ERROR("Topic Deleted"); }
00111 
00112     /** publish/distribute the message to all listeners to the given serviceId.
00113      * if shallSendToNetwork the message will be forwarded to gateways too (default).
00114      * warning 1: Never use it from an interrupt server.
00115      * warning 2: the pointer to msg will be distributed. A Subscriber may modify its content
00116      */
00117     unsigned long publish(void *msg, bool shallSendToNetwork = true,
00118                 NetMsgInfo* netMsgInfo = 0);
00119 
00120     /** Usually we use the length of the corresponding data type associated to the topic
00121      * but for some exceptional cases, like for strings, we may send shorter messages.
00122      * warning 1: Never use it from an interrupt server.
00123      * warning 2: the pointer to msg will be distributed. A Subscriber may modify its content
00124      */
00125     unsigned long publishMsgPart(void *msg, unsigned int lenToSend,
00126             bool shallSendToNetwork = true, NetMsgInfo* netMsgInfo = 0);
00127 
00128     /** Publishfrom interrupts uses no semaphores as protection!
00129       * the Subscriber shall use no thread operations
00130       * the Subscriber shall be as short as possible
00131       */
00132     void publishFromInterrupt(void *any, int len = 0);
00133 
00134     /** request is like publish, but the calles expects data back instead of sending it.
00135       * The internal mechanims is identical the same like publisch, the middleware will
00136       * call puuters from subscribers. Such puters shall proivde data instad of geting it.
00137       **/
00138 
00139      inline unsigned long requestLocal(void *msg) { return publish(msg, false); }
00140 
00141      /// return 0 it not found
00142      static TopicInterface* findTopicId(long wantedTopicId);
00143 
00144 };
00145 
00146 
00147 /**
00148  *  @class Topic
00149  *  @brief Topic  to patch publisher and subscribers
00150  *
00151  *  The middleware communication is based on the publisher/subscriber protocol.
00152  *  Publishers make messages public under a given topic.
00153  *  Subscriber to a given topic get all messages which are published
00154  *  under the given topic.
00155  * To establish a transfer path, both,
00156  * publisher and subscriber have to share the same topic.
00157  *
00158  * A Topic consists of a pair: a data-type and an integer representing
00159  * the topic identifier.
00160  *
00161  * Topic provides methods to publish and distribute messages.
00162  *
00163  * The current implementation accepts only shorts as topicId
00164  * because of limitations on the FPGA (Hardware) Middleware
00165  * implementation.
00166  *
00167  * topic id 0 is reserved for middleware messages (eg. topic lists)
00168  * if you use topic id -1 the system will generate an id according
00169  * to the name used in the constructor. This number will be
00170  * compatible with all hardware implementations. We recommend
00171  * to use this feature. This is compatible with our hardware
00172  * networks.
00173  *
00174  */
00175 
00176 /*************************************/
00177 
00178 template <class Type>
00179 class Topic : public TopicInterface {
00180 public:
00181 
00182     /** constructor, parameter name is used for debug purposes and as hash value
00183       * to generate a topic id if it was defined as -1. This is the proposed
00184        * method.
00185       */
00186     Topic(long id, const char* name) : TopicInterface(id, sizeof(Type), name) { }
00187 
00188     ~Topic() {
00189         ERROR("topic deleted");
00190     }
00191 
00192     /** publish/distribute the message to all listeners to the given serviceId.
00193      * if shallSendToNetwork the message will be fordarded to gateways too (default)
00194      * warning 1: Never use it from an interrupt server.
00195      * warning 2: the pointer to msg will be distributed. A Subscriber may modify its content
00196      */
00197     inline unsigned long publish(Type &msg, bool shallSendToNetwork = true) {
00198         return TopicInterface::publish(&msg, shallSendToNetwork);
00199     }
00200 
00201     /** To publish constants,
00202      * But please only for basic data types (char, short, long, float, double)
00203      */
00204     inline unsigned long publishConst(Type msgConst, bool shallSendToNetwork = true) {
00205         Type msg = msgConst;
00206         return TopicInterface::publish(&msg, shallSendToNetwork);
00207     }
00208 
00209 
00210     /** To send only a part of the data type, and not the whole object.
00211       *for example for strings
00212       * warning: Never us it from an interrupt server.
00213       */
00214     inline unsigned long publishMsgPart(Type &msg, unsigned int lenToSend, bool shallSendToNetwork = true) {
00215         return TopicInterface::publishMsgPart(&msg, lenToSend, shallSendToNetwork);
00216     }
00217 
00218     /** request is like publish, but the calles expects data back instead of sending it.
00219       * The internal mechanims is identical the same like publisch, the middleware will
00220       * call puuters from subscribers. Such puters shall proivde data instad of geting it.
00221       **/
00222 
00223      inline unsigned long requestLocal(Type &msg) { return TopicInterface::publish(&msg, false); }
00224 
00225 };
00226 
00227 /***
00228  ** very often we need a generiv type for topics which contians just
00229  ** a pointer and a len.
00230  ** to avoid 100x declarations fo this struct, we define ohe here
00231  **/
00232 
00233 struct GenericMsgRef {
00234     long  context; ///< any further infoy you would like to deliver
00235     char* msgPtr;
00236     int   msgLen;
00237 
00238     GenericMsgRef() { msgLen = context = 0; msgPtr = 0; }
00239 };
00240 
00241 /**************************************************************/
00242 /** A topic only for gateways */
00243 
00244 extern Topic<GenericMsgRef> defaultGatewayTopic; //All localy publiched Topics go here for the Gateways and/or Routers to send out
00245 extern Topic<NetworkMessage> defaultRouterTopic; //All incoming Messages are publiched here by the Gateways.
00246 /************ Predifined Topics from Interrupt servers **********/
00247 
00248 extern Topic<void*> interruptTimer;
00249 extern Topic<void*> interruptUart;
00250 extern Topic<void*> interruptSigterm;
00251 extern Topic<GenericMsgRef> charInput; ///< used instead of getcharNoWait()
00252 
00253 
00254 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00255 }
00256 #endif
